findings.title: Misuse of the different call methods
Division by zero errors
findings.description: Potential division by zero error in get-entitled-stacking-reward() function of core contract.

findings.title: Missing or misused function qualifiers
findings.description: The audit report highlights the presence of missing or misused function qualifiers.

findings.title: Needlessly complex code and contract interactions
findings.description: The code contains unnecessarily complex logic and interactions between contracts, making it harder to understand and maintain.

findings.title: Poor or nonexistent error handling
findings.description: The audit report highlights the lack of proper error handling mechanisms, which can lead to unforeseen consequences and system failures.

findings.title: Failure to use a withdrawal pattern
findings.description: The contract does not implement a withdrawal pattern, which can lead to issues with token refunds or withdrawals.

findings.title: Insufficient validation of the input parameters
Malicious Inactive Core Contract Can Mint and Burn Tokens
findings.description: The token contract only validates if the contract caller is registered in the auth contract. However, contracts cannot be removed from the auth contract. Therefore, if a malicious core were added and then replaced by the approvers, it could still mint new tokens and burn someone else's tokens.
